review_title: Avoid unless you enjoy being a puppet
pros:
Offered training
The few activities you actually do with the clients, when you're not busy doing a workload that's not even yours.
cons:
Only one person allowed off for Annual Leave at a time.
Managers delegating their work load to P/A, thus not being client focused because you're up to your eyeballs in paperwork that should not be done by us shop floor assistants.
Favouritism with managers (Get in the good books and you get away with murder!)
Salary is naff. No enhancements besides a couple of bank holidays and a joke of a night rate for your nightshifts.
Overtime has gone down to basic hourly rate.
No flexi work allowed anymore but no doubt managers will still be entitled to such luxuries. 
Managers who DO NOT spend time around the clients trying to tell you how you should support the clients even though, as a p/a you spend more time with the clients than you do with your own family and you know them like the back of your hand and what works best for them and what doesn't. 
On-call? What's the point in that when you ring them in the middle of the night with a concern and you get snarled at for waking them up and to be told there's no point of them coming out to the house because they live on the other side of town! RIDICULOUS!
